result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Norah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with 2 days credit.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA);
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
- If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Correction from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No possession of any animal, no animals in household.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
FOR A PERIOD OF 5 YEARS, THE DEFENDANT MAY NOT OWN ANY ANIMAL.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for work.
Court stayed commencement until 1/23/2015 at 5:00pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert C Norah

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert C Norah in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 2 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time with Huber for work.  Court stayed commencement until 01/23/2015 at 5:00pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No posession of any animal, no animals in household.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

FOR A PERIOD OF 5 YEARS THE DEFENDANT MAY NOT OWN ANY ANIMAL.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form
PSI received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.
Letters in support of the defendant received and filed.
Letters from Dustin Z and David M received and filed.

Defendant Robert C Norah in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from Edwin A received and filed.

Defendant Robert C Norah in court with attorney Adam C. Essling.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Parties request more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
